support_summary: RAD23A physically binds ATXN3 UIM domains (Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Shuttling and processing of polyubiquitinated proteins for 26S proteasomal degradation.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 binds RAD23A to coordinate the deubiquitination and delivery of substrates to the proteasome.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 UIM domains bind RAD23A UBL domain → ATXN3 is recruited to the 26S proteasome → ATXN3 deubiquitinates (trims) K48/K63-linked chains on RAD23-bound substrates → Prevents non-productive substrate accumulation → Facilitates substrate translocation into the proteasome catalytic chamber.
specific_effects: Stabilizes ATXN3 protein half-life by preventing its own degradation
Enhances the clearance of polyubiquitinated substrates
Trims long ubiquitin chains to optimize proteasomal recognition

evidence.paper_title: Ubiquitin-binding site 2 of ataxin-3 prevents its proteasomal degradation by interacting with Rad23
evidence.relevant_quote: Ataxin-3 interacts with the proteasome-associated proteins Rad23A/B through UbS2. Knockdown of Rad23 in cultured cells and in Drosophila results in lower levels of ataxin-3 protein.

evidence.paper_title: Interaction of the polyglutamine protein ataxin-3 with Rad23 regulates toxicity in Drosophila models of Spinocerebellar Ataxia Type 3
evidence.relevant_quote: Ataxin-3's degradation is inhibited by its binding to the proteasome shuttle Rad23 through ubiquitin-binding site 2 (UbS2).

mechanism_correction: The interaction is reciprocal: RAD23A stabilizes ATXN3 by preventing its premature proteasomal degradation, while ATXN3 uses RAD23A as a shuttle to reach the proteasome where it deubiquitinates RAD23-bound substrates to facilitate their entry into the 20S core.
mechanism: Shuttling and processing of polyubiquitinated proteins for 26S proteasomal degradation.
effect: ATXN3 binds RAD23A to coordinate the deubiquitination and delivery of substrates to the proteasome.
summary: ATXN3 activates RAD23A to modulate proteasomal protein degradation, ultimately affecting facilitates substrate translocation into the proteasome catalytic chamber.

evidence.paper_title: Ubiquitin-binding site 2 of ataxin-3 prevents its proteasomal degradation by interacting with Rad23
evidence.relevant_quote: Ataxin-3 interacts with the proteasome-associated proteins Rad23A/B through UbS2. Knockdown of Rad23 in cultured cells and in Drosophila results in lower levels of ataxin-3 protein.

evidence.paper_title: Interaction of the polyglutamine protein ataxin-3 with Rad23 regulates toxicity in Drosophila models of Spinocerebellar Ataxia Type 3
evidence.relevant_quote: Ataxin-3's degradation is inhibited by its binding to the proteasome shuttle Rad23 through ubiquitin-binding site 2 (UbS2).

initial_pathway.reasoning: RAD23A acts as a shuttle protein that delivers ubiquitinated substrates to the proteasome; Ataxin-3 interacts with it to modulate protein turnover.
